item.title: Report X-2023071236
item.description:
Report X-2023071236

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PD1 FOR LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE AND SPILL CART. UPON ARRIVING, RESPONDER NOTICED A FLAMMABLE LIQUID PACKAGE LEAKING AS WELL. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL. PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED MATERIAL WERE PLACED INTO SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023070455
item.description:
Report X-2023070455

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF BY CUSTOMER TO THE CUSTOMER COUNTER AND THE CLERK NOTICED A WET SPOT SO THE PACKAGE WAS OPEN TO DETERMINE IF THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING UPON OPENING, EMPLOYEE NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS NOT LEAKING AND THAT THE PACKAGE WAS HAZARDOUS, DID NOT LEAK. CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK AND WAS TOLD TO PROCESS AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2023070400
item.description:
Report X-2023070400

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET/STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY THE CENTER CLERK AT THE WEST COUNTY BOXLINE-2 STATION. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALLS AND BASE OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED FIBERBOARD PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST.

item.title: Report E-2023080051
item.description:
Report E-2023080051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit on I-70 eastbound in St. Louis, MO the XPO truck/trailer was involved in a rollover accident which damaged nine of the metal 55 gallon drums of 2-pentanone(un1993) but only releasing 0.5 quart from a damaged bung. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking by the unload when it arrived at the station. Package placed into a lined tote and removed to the hazmat cage for processing DescribePack: It appears that the product leaked via the vented caps due to improper loading and failure to declare hazmat DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fans in the area, placed in a lined sealed tote.
